title: SplitIt
subtitle: Group Expense Splitting
description:
Split It is a Flutter-based budget-splitting app built to simplify managing shared expenses within a group. It allows users to create "splits" for various group activities, add contributors, and record transactions to track who paid, how much, and for what purpose. The app also offers a smart settlement feature, which calculates and displays the exact transactions needed to equalize the groupâ€™s expenses, making it easy to settle bills.

On the technical side, Split It is a Flutter app that uses the Isar database for offline-first data management, ensuring that users can create and manage splits without the need for an internet connection. The database structure efficiently stores splits, contributors, and transaction data in a way that is easy to retrieve and update. No authentication or account setup is required, making it privacy-focused and simple to use.

title: MemChess
subtitle: Memory + Chess
description:
Memchess is a 2 player online game that combines memory and chess. It consists of a memory board and a chess board, both played simultaneously. The memory tiles represent pieces on the chess board and have a direct link to them. Matching a pair will delete the corresponding piece from the chess board and capturing a piece will remove it's tiles from the memory board.This unique combination allows for new strategies and plays that are not possible in traditional chess. 

 This project is  separed into a client and server. The client is made in TypeScript and React, using libraries like Tailwind CSS and Daisy UI for styling and chess.js and SocketIO for fucntionality. The server is a Rust Axum server, deployed via Shuttle that control the SocketIO server and server-side valdation for the game. The UI is fully responsive and also features a dark mode.

title: Ranker
subtitle: Ranking Website
description:
An anonymous and social platform to share opinionated rankings of customizable questions and choices .

Ranker is a online platform to post questions in the form of polls and users can anonymously rank those options and give their opinion. The average opinion is compiled and presented to the user. The user can also see the rankings of other users and compare them to their own.

The website is made using NextJS and TypeScript for the frontend and DrizzleORM and PostgreSQL for the backend. The website is hosted on Vercel and uses a PostgreSQL database to store user data and poll data. The website has a clean and modern design that is easy to use and navigate. It is also full responsive and features an execellent interface on mobile with animations and gestures.

title: uType
subtitle: Typing Test
description:
uType is a typing practice and testing platform that offers features like customizable tests, stat tracking and leaderboards. It also uses a score system to rank users and tests. The score of a test is calculated using a formula that involves numerous parameters like CPM, WPM, Average word length, time taken etc. It is intended to give a fair assesment of a user's performance independant of the options they chose for the test.

The website is made using Flask and SQLite for the backend and HTML/CSS/JS for the frontend. The website is hosted on Render and uses a sqliite database to store user data and test data. The website has a simple and clean design that is easy to use and navigate.

title: React Mineweeper
subtitle: Minesweeper Clone
description:
This is a Minesweeper clone I made as my first project when I was learning React. It features the standard minesweeper gameplay with some nice animations and also some customizability like board size and mine count. The game has a clean and modern design that is easy to use and navigate. It is also fully responsive.

The website is made using React and TypeScript for the frontend and CSS for the styling. The website is hosted on Vercel.The website has a simple and clean design that is easy to use and navigate.

title: CLI Chess
subtitle: Chess Clone
description: A Chess clone in C++ I made to practice OOPS. It has a Object Oriented design with classes for pieces, board, game etc. The game is made using C++ and the standard library and uses ASCII escape codes for displaying the board. The game has a simple interface that is easy to use and takes input from the user in form of moves written in algebric and chess notation. I also created the chess engine from scratch that is able to process and validate all chess moves and handle the board logic.

title: Slime Invasion
subtitle: 2D Tower Defense
description: A 2D tower defence game I made using Python and Pygame. It was a collaborative project for a 2-day game jam with an online friend of mine. The game features a wave based system where the player has to defend their base from incoming slimes. The player can place towers on the map to attack the slimes and earn money to buy more towers. The game has simple controls and allows the user to directly take control of the placed towers for more interactivity. It also features a high score system and a shop to buy towers. The game is available for download on itch.io. I also did the art and sound design for this game, all assets used are made by us.
